chapters.chapter: Exploring the Investigative World of Science

topics.content: Science is the systematic study of nature based on observation, experimentation, and logical reasoning.
Scientific investigation involves asking questions, forming hypotheses, conducting experiments, and drawing conclusions.

chapters.chapter: The Invisible Living World: Beyond Our Naked Eye

topics.content: Microorganisms are very small living organisms that cannot be seen without a microscope.
Microorganisms include bacteria, fungi, protozoa, algae, and viruses.
Some microorganisms are useful in food and medicine, while others cause diseases.
Health is a state of complete physical, mental, and social well-being.
Communicable diseases spread from one person to another through air, water, or contact.
Diseases can be prevented by maintaining hygiene, balanced diet, and vaccination.
Electric current is the flow of electric charge through a conductor.
When electric current flows through a conductor, it produces heat.
Electric current produces a magnetic field around the conductor.
A force is a push or pull that can change the motion or shape of an object.
Forces can be contact forces or non-contact forces.
A force can change the speed, direction, or shape of an object.
Pressure is the force acting on a unit area of a surface.
Air exerts pressure in all directions.
Cyclones are violent storms caused by low air pressure and high-speed winds.
Matter is anything that has mass and occupies space.
Matter is made up of tiny particles that are constantly moving.

chapters.chapter: Nature of Matter: Elements, Compounds, and Mixtures

topics.content: An element is a pure substance made up of only one type of atom.
A compound is formed when two or more elements combine chemically.
A mixture is a combination of substances that are not chemically combined.

chapters.chapter: The Amazing World of Solutes, Solvents, and Solutions

topics.content: A solution is a homogeneous mixture of a solute and a solvent.
The solute dissolves in the solvent to form a solution.
Reflection is the bouncing back of light from a surface.
Mirrors reflect light, while lenses bend light to form images.
Celestial bodies include the Sun, Moon, stars, and planets.
Day and night occur due to Earth's rotation, while seasons occur due to Earth's revolution.
An ecosystem is a system formed by the interaction of living organisms with their environment.
Nature maintains balance through food chains and natural cycles.

chapters.chapter: Our Home: Earth, a Unique Life Sustaining Planet

topics.content: Earth supports life due to the presence of air, water, suitable temperature, and gravity.
Conservation helps protect Earth's resources for future generations.
